alert.note: Alert for Coshocton; Guernsey; Muskingum; Tuscarawas (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 29 at 2:54AM EDT until July 29 at 3:15AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 AM EDT FOR NORTHWESTERN GUERNSEY...SOUTHEASTERN COSHOCTON...NORTHEASTERN MUSKINGUM AND SOUTH CENTRAL TUSCARAWAS COUNTIES... At 254 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 9 miles north of New Concord, or 10 miles southeast of Coshocton, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... Coshocton, Cambridge, Newcomerstown, New Concord, Byesville, West Lafayette, Lore City, Old Washington, Plainfield, Gilmore, Otsego, Birmingham, Boden, Salt Fork State Park, and Kimbolton. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
